content:
Sarek Germline Single Sample Analysis

Specialized Germline Variant Discovery Pipeline

This optimized configuration of nf-core/sarek is specifically designed for comprehensive germline variant calling on single normal samples without matched tumor data. Perfect for constitutional variant discovery, hereditary disease studies, and population genomics research.

Analysis Capabilities

üìä SNVs & INDELs

Tools: GATK HaplotypeCaller, DeepVariant, FreeBayes, mpileup, Strelka2
Applications: Single nucleotide variants and small insertions/deletions in germline samples

üîó Structural Variants

Tools: Manta, TIDDIT
Applications: Large genomic rearrangements and chromosomal alterations

üìà Copy Number Variations

Tools: CNVkit, Control-FREEC
Applications: Germline CNV detection and copy number analysis

üîç Quality Control

Tools: indexcov, FastQC, MultiQC
Applications: Comprehensive coverage analysis and quality assessment

Input Requirements

CSV Samplesheet Format

The pipeline requires a CSV samplesheet defining your germline samples:

patient,sample,lane,fastq_1,fastq_2
patient1,normal,1,normal_R1.fastq.gz,normal_R2.fastq.gz
patient2,sample,1,sample_R1.fastq.gz,sample_R2.fastq.gz

Column Specifications

  • ‚úÖ patient (REQUIRED): Patient/subject identifier
    Examples: patient1, subject_A, SAMPLE_001

  • ‚úÖ sample (REQUIRED): Sample identifier (typically 'normal' or 'sample' for germline)
    Examples: normal, sample, control

  • ‚úÖ lane (REQUIRED): Sequencing lane number (use 1 if unknown)

  • ‚úÖ fastq_1 (REQUIRED): Path to forward read FASTQ file

  • ‚ùå fastq_2 (OPTIONAL): Path to reverse read FASTQ file (omit for single-end)

Variant Calling Tools

Select from industry-standard germline variant callers:

üß¨ Germline Callers

GATK HaplotypeCaller: Gold standard for germline SNVs/INDELs (Recommended)
DeepVariant: Deep learning-based variant calling
FreeBayes: Bayesian haplotype-based calling
mpileup: Basic variant calling for quick analysis

üîó Structural Variants

Manta: Comprehensive structural variant detection
TIDDIT: Chromosomal rearrangement identification

üìà Copy Number

CNVkit: Copy number variation detection
Control-FREEC: Copy number and allelic content analysis

Quality Control & Preprocessing

  • üìä Read QC: FastQC quality assessment and adapter trimming

  • üéØ Alignment: BWA-MEM2 mapping with duplicate marking

  • ‚öñÔ∏è Base Recalibration: GATK base quality score recalibration

  • üîç Coverage Analysis: indexcov for comprehensive coverage assessment

Output Files

üóÇÔ∏è Variant Calls (VCF)

Standard variant call format with comprehensive annotations

‚úÖ Filtered Variants (VCF)

High-confidence germline variant calls passing quality filters

üìã Quality Reports (HTML)

MultiQC comprehensive analysis summary

üìÅ Alignment Files (BAM/CRAM)

Processed alignment files with indices

üìä Statistics (TSV/JSON)

Coverage, mapping quality, and variant metrics

Applications

Perfect for: Hereditary disease studies ‚Ä¢ Population genomics ‚Ä¢ Pharmacogenomics ‚Ä¢ Constitutional variant discovery ‚Ä¢ Genetic screening ‚Ä¢ Research genomics ‚Ä¢ Clinical genomics ‚Ä¢ Single-sample analysis

jobConfig.label: System Size
jobConfig.name: system_size
jobConfig.description: Choose computing resources based on dataset size. Germline variant calling requires substantial memory for whole genome analysis.

options.label: Small (16 CPUs, 90GB RAM) - Exome or targeted sequencing
Medium (32 CPUs, 180GB RAM) - Whole genome single sample
Large (64 CPUs, 360GB RAM) - Recommended for WGS

spec.label: Samplesheet CSV
spec.name: input
spec.description: CSV samplesheet with columns: patient, sample, lane, fastq_1, fastq_2. Defines experimental design and FASTQ file locations for germline samples.

spec.label: Output Directory
spec.name: output
spec.description: Directory where germline variant calling results, QC reports, and intermediate files will be saved.

spec.label: Variant Calling Tools
spec.name: tools
spec.description: Select germline variant calling algorithms. HaplotypeCaller is recommended for most germline analyses. Multiple tools can be specified for comprehensive analysis.

spec.label: No Intervals
spec.name: no_intervals
spec.description: Disable usage of intervals for whole genome analysis. Enable this for unbiased whole genome variant calling without predefined intervals.
